title: Is our own lives also considered a 'visual novel'? - Quora

response.answer_text: Our lives are, in fact, very similar to a story, we lead it looking for an answer, or looking for a purpose, or simply going through the motions. We have things that happen to us that can make us feel one way or another, tribulations and successes, and some people aren’t good people, morally, but that would make for a great story. I mean, think about all the autobiographies out there, and biographies. There’s visual novels on historical events, like times during segregation and MLK’s look to change America. I’d like to think that everyone’s lives is like a story, just waiting to be written. You can put so many perspectives too, make yourself the hero or the villain, the apathetic or the much too caring. :) Things you do all write out a story. I’ve had people tell me that they think my life is “interesting” and it seems like it would be a fictional novel. Some people aren’t satisfied with their stories being “boring” and it makes them adventure. Some people mis-genre their stories as romance, or action, when really our lives are so many things at once. So yes, I do think our lives are like stories, just waiting to be told. <3 tsu! - out.

I'm thinking yes. If yes to that idea, then take it, chew on it, shake it, sit on it, hatch it, fondle it, focus it, feel it abstract it pause it get down to the marrow. If that's true how could that point of view serve you as you advance the story?
